data.name: Substance Designer
data.title: Material and texture creation
data.body: Substance Designer now offers scripting functionality based on the Python language (version 3.7.6). Link: https://docs.substance3d.com/sddoc/scripting-172825017.html

data.name: Substance Painter
data.title: Material and texture painting
data.body: No direct python integration. A javascript API with QML support is available. See: https://docs.substance3d.com/spdoc/plugins-154140929.html

data.name: SynthEyes
data.title: 3D Tracking
data.body: SyPy3 API: https://www.ssontech.com/python.html

data.name: Flame
data.title: Compositing and Finishing
data.body: Python API targets 2.7: http://help.autodesk.com/view/FLAME/2021/ENU/?guid=Flame_API_Python_API_html

data.name: Maya
data.title: 3D DCC
data.body: Available for Linux in latest 2020 Beta
data.label: Preview

data.name: MotionBuilder
data.title: Motion capture playback and editing
data.body: Unclear, but the following would hint at Python 2.7 interpreter with ability to enable Python 3 compatibility warnings: http://help.autodesk.com/view/MOBPRO/2020/ENU/?guid=__files_GUID_989682FC_305F_4925_8B37_66490BC45C4C_htm

data.name: RV
data.title: Media playback
data.body: Public version uses Python 2.7 as per https://support.shotgunsoftware.com/hc/en-us/articles/219042198-Python-FAQ-customization-and-extension-

data.name: 3ds Max
data.title: 3D DCC
data.body:
Starting with 3ds Max 2021, both Python 3.7 and Python 2.7 interpreters are included with 3ds Max. Python 3 is the default:
https://help.autodesk.com/view/MAXDEV/2021/ENU/?guid=Max_Python_API_python_3_support_html

data.name: Deadline
data.title: Renderfarm management
data.body: 2.7 & 3.7 support across all 3 OS platforms will be provided to customers.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Fusion
data.title: Compositor
data.body: https://forum.blackmagicdesign.com/viewtopic.php?f=21&t=100770

data.name: Mocha Pro
data.title: Motion tracking and rotoscoping
data.body: The Mocha Python API moves to Python 3.7.3 from Python 2.7: https://borisfx.com/support/documentation/mocha/7.0.0/python-guide/

data.name: Silhouette
data.title: Roto, paint, compositing
data.body: VFX Reference Platform 2020 and Python 3 support: https://borisfx.com/products/silhouette/?collection=silhouette&product=silhouette

data.name: Cerebro
data.title: Project management / production tracking
data.body: Supports both python 2.x and 3.x: https://cerebrohq.com/docs/en/sapi_python.html

data.name: V-Ray (SDK)
data.title: Renderer
data.body: Python 2.7, 3.6 or 3.7 (x64): https://docs.chaosgroup.com/display/APPSDK/System+requirements

data.name: Conductor
data.title: Cloud rendering service
data.body: Support for python 2.7
data.label: In Progress

data.name: cineSync
data.title: Remote review and approval
data.body: Python API last update from 2013

data.name: Touch Designer
data.title: Node based visual programming language
data.body: The current version of Python shipped with TouchDesigner is 3.7: https://docs.derivative.ca/Introduction_to_Python_Tutorial#Importing_Modules

data.name: VUE
data.title: 3D environment
data.body: The Python documentation has been rewritten and new functions have been added. Package moved also from Python 2.7 to Python 3.8: https://info.e-onsoftware.com/blog/r5

data.name: Plantfactory
data.title: 3D plant creation
data.body: The Python documentation has been rewritten and new functions have been added. Package moved also from Python 2.7 to Python 3.8: https://info.e-onsoftware.com/blog/r5

data.name: Unreal
data.title: Game engine
data.body: GitHub repo is private, need to request access. Embedded interpreter is 2.7, can replace with 3.x if you rebuild from source. https://docs.unrealengine.com/en-US/Engine/Editor/ScriptingAndAutomation/Python/index.html
data.label: Needs a rebuild

data.name: Alembic
data.title: Geometry cache format
data.body:
Possibly not working yet:
- https://github.com/alembic/alembic/issues/216
- https://github.com/alembic/alembic/issues/279

data.name: OpenImageIO
data.title: Image Formats
data.body: Uses pybind11, supports and tests against 2.7, 3.6, 3.7

data.name: PyMel
data.title: Python integration in Maya
data.body: Presumably tightly connected with Maya python 3 porting efforts.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: numpy
data.title: scientific computing lib for python
data.body: From v1.19.0 onwards, numpy supports python3 only (dropped 2.7 support).

data.name: gaffer
data.title: Lookdev, Lighting and Automation
data.body: Python 3 support in progess.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: rez
data.title: Pipeline Virtual/Environment
data.body: Supports both python 2 and 3.

data.name: Blender
data.title: 3D DCC
data.body: Blender uses Python 3.x; some online documentation still assumes version 2.x: https://docs.blender.org/api/current/info_quickstart.html#before-starting

data.name: Qt.py
data.title: Shim for multiple Python bindings to Qt
data.body: Bindings run on both 2.x and 3.x versions: https://github.com/mottosso/Qt.py#developer-guide

data.name: cgkit
data.title: Utilities
data.body: Unclear, but the original dataset states Python 3 is supported so it is left as is for now.

data.name: fileseq
data.title: A Python library for parsing frame ranges
data.body: Supports both python 2 and 3

data.name: pyside2
data.title: Qt5 python bindings
data.body: Dropped support for Python 2 on precompiled versions

data.name: pyopengl
data.title: Cross platform Python binding to OpenGL
data.body: Still recommends 2.7 but support for 3.x has been added.
data.label: Preview

data.name: pyseq
data.title: Python sequence string module
data.body: Python 3 support added as per: https://github.com/rsgalloway/pyseq/pull/9

data.name: cortex
data.title: Libraries for visual effects software development
data.body: Python 3 porting in progess.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: conda
data.title: Package, dependency and environment management
data.body:
Anaconda supports Python 2.7, 3.6, and 3.7. The default is Python 2.7 or 3.7, depending on which installer you used:
- For the installers "Anaconda" and "Miniconda," the default is 2.7.
- For the installers "Anaconda3" or "Miniconda3," the default is 3.7.

data.name: USD
data.title: Scene description library and format
data.body:
Python3 supported since 20.05 https://github.com/PixarAnimationStudios/USD/issues/1067

3rd party dependency list with versions: https://github.com/PixarAnimationStudios/USD/blob/release/VERSIONS.md

data.name: SeExpr
data.title: Expression language
data.body: https://github.com/wdas/SeExpr/commit/420d9584379c5951e3ac035ef438f46c3062bfb5

data.name: Partio
data.title: Particle interface
data.body: https://github.com/wdas/partio/commit/3a3725bc3687dd61ff915b3f9705aef26784c197

data.name: OpenColorIO
data.title: Color science
data.body: https://lists.aswf.io/g/ocio-dev/topic/30499473#1770
data.label: In Progress

data.name: OpenTimelineIO
data.title: Editorial timeline
data.body: Uses pybind11, supports and tests against 2.7, 3.7, 3.8

data.name: OpenCue
data.title: Render queue manager
data.body: Setting up developer environment now requires Python 3.x

data.name: OpenEXR
data.title: Image file format
data.body: Python binding an be built against 3.7 as per official CI/CD configuration.

data.name: OpenVDB
data.title: Volumetric data storage and processing
data.body: Supports Python3 since August 2016. Unclear which minor version is tested against.

data.name: Nuke
data.title: Compositor
data.body: Python 3 support is undergoing internal testing at Foundry. Currently a tech preview 13.1v1a2 available for testing.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Katana
data.title: Lighting
data.body: Python 3 support in progress.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Modo
data.title: 3D DCC
data.body: Python 3 support in testing at Foundry. The hope is to phase the transition during the course of the year (first with 3 as tech preview with 2 fully supported, and thereafter with 2 deprecated with 3 as fully supported).
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Mari
data.title: 3D Painting and Texturing
data.body: Python 3 support in progress.Tech Preview available here https://community.foundry.com/discuss/topic/153645/python-3-tech-preview-mari-4-6
data.label: Preview

data.name: Flix
data.title: Storyboarding
data.body: Python 3 update expected for Flix 6.4 or later.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Frame.io
data.title: Media management and review
data.body: Python 3 support improved in latest v0.7.5 update. Tested against 2.7, 3.7, 3.8 (soon 3.6).

data.name: ftrack
data.title: Project management / production tracking
data.body: Python 3 API support: https://www.ftrack.com/en/2019/02/the-ftrack-python-3-api-preview-is-available-today.html
data.label: Preview

data.name: Clarisse
data.title: Scene assembly and lighting
data.body: Both Python 2.7.x and Python 3.7.x will be available in the next major version targeted for 2020 (python version will be selectable at startup)
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Massive Prime
data.title: Crowd Simulation
data.body: Massive Prime has Python API

data.name: Cinema4D
data.title: 3D DCC
data.body: Python API in R23 is based on 3.7.7 https://developers.maxon.net/

data.name: Qube
data.title: Renderfarm management
data.body: qb.py API module not Python 3 compatible for now: https://www.pipelinefx.com/docs/API_Python_Html/qb-pysrc.html

data.name: Renderman (SDK)
data.title: Renderer
data.body: Support for python3 bindings are available for 3.4 and 3.5: https://rmanwiki.pixar.com/display/REN23/RenderMan+23.0

data.name: Tractor
data.title: Renderfarm management
data.body: Components still require Python 2.7

data.name: 3DEqualizer
data.title: 3D Tracking
data.body: Ships with Python 2.7 interpreter

data.name: shotgun_api3
data.title: Shotgun SDK
data.body: Supports both python 2 and 3

data.name: SGTK
data.title: Shotgun pipeline toolkit
data.body: See above roadmap comment, also note they are doing qt5 transition.
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Houdini
data.title: 3D DCC
data.body: SideFX released a separate Python 3 Tech Preview build in 2019 for Houdini 18.0 in addition to the main Python 2 build.  The Tech Preview build is not production ready.  SideFX is aiming to release a production ready Python 3 build in 2020.
data.label: Preview

data.name: pftrack
data.title: 3D Tracking
data.body: Python 2.6 as per https://support-thepixelfarm.co.uk/documentation/docs/pftrack_macros_python_api.html

data.name: Unity
data.title: Game Engine / Real Time Rendering / VR
data.body: Python 3 support is in the works as per: https://forum.unity.com/threads/introducing-python-for-unity-editor.812748/
data.label: In Progress

data.name: Meshroom
data.title: Photogrammetry software
data.body: Testing against 3.x exclusively since April 2020
